name: Clint Mansell
description:
'''Clinton Darryl Mansell''' ({{IPAc-en|ˈ|m|æ|n|s|əl}}; born 7 November 1963) is an English [[musician]], [[Singing|singer]], and [[composer]]. He served as the [[lead vocalist]] of [[alt-rock]] band [[Pop Will Eat Itself]]. After the band's dissolution, Mansell moved to the United States and embarked on a career as a [[film score]] composer.

Mansell partnered with American filmmaker [[Darren Aronofsky]] and composed the scores for his films ''[[Pi (film)|Pi]]'', ''[[Requiem for a Dream]]'', ''[[The Fountain]]'', ''[[The Wrestler (2008 film)|The Wrestler]]'', ''[[Black Swan (film)|Black Swan]]'', and ''[[Noah (2014 film)|Noah]]''. Mansell is best known for the [[Requiem for a Dream (soundtrack)|''Requiem for a Dream'' soundtrack]], particularly the film's composition "[[Lux Aeterna (Mansell)|Lux Aeterna]]" and a re-orchestrated version titled "Requiem for a Tower" that was created for ''[[The Lord of the Rings: The Two Towers]]'' trailer, both of which have been featured in multiple advertisements, films, [[film trailers]], video games and other media.

He provided the scores for the [[Ben Wheatley]] films ''[[High-Rise (film)|High-Rise]]'', ''[[Happy New Year, Colin Burstead]]'', ''[[Rebecca (2020 film)|Rebecca]]'', and ''[[In the Earth]]''. Other films featuring Mansell's scores include ''[[Sahara (2005 film)|Sahara]]'', ''[[Moon (2009 film)|Moon]]'' and ''[[Stoker (film)|Stoker]]''. He has also composed music for television and video games.

Mansell was nominated for a [[Golden Globe]] for his work on ''The Fountain'', and was nominated for multiple [[Grammy Awards]] for his work on ''Black Swan''.
